head.supplied: 22/10/92 ¶ ¶ Should there be at your Office, dear Mr Wilson, still any copies of any volumes of Bentham's and my "Flora Australiensis," would you kindly let me have one of each? The set here through ...

div.p: U92/9630, unit 704, VPRS 3992/P inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.

To proof. NOTE – this is 92.10.22 and is filed there – has 92.12.07 overprinted another letter which should go here – check on floppy disk.
485?
22/10/92

Should there be at your Office, dear Mr Wilson, still any copies of any volumes of Bentham's and my "Flora Australiensis," would you kindly let me have one of each? The set here through so many years use has become so worn out, that the pages in many places can be hardly any longer kept together.
The Chief Secretary, A. McLean, minuted his approval on 25 October. MS annotation in an unknown hand, dated 3 Novewmber: 'The work is out of print. Is the copy in this Office to be supplied to the Baron?' On 5 November Wilson instructed: 'Send the copy'. There is another faint note dated 25/10 about there only being one copy in the […]. Get copy of letter to M, 10/11 No. 5962.
See also M to T. Wilson, 12 November 1892.
